 2. in cooperation with other relevant state agencies and stakeholders
identify, and develop as necessary, guidance for therapy dogs, their
handlers and facilities using such dogs, including, but not limited to,
assessment and training, risk management, animal welfare, and best
practices for such dogs and their dog-handlers. Such guidance shall be
made available on the department's website and provided to
municipalities that issue special tags for therapy dogs pursuant to
section one hundred eleven of this article.
